job_title: Remote Medical Records Specialist in Raleigh, NC

review_title: If this is the ONLY job you can get, then ok
pros: There are some really sweet ladies and gentlemen that work here...that’s it!
cons: Just like every other review on here, management/leadership need serious help...if you transition from one company to another, protocol should tell you that in order to fully prepare your employees, you need to go over all policies and procedures that may change during/after the transition to make sure that they are FULLY supported...clearly that didn’t happen...and we are almost a full month into being DLP employees and there are procedures and information that STILL hasn’t been gone over, but we are held accountable for upholding those policies and procedures!! DONT EXPECT FOR YOUR SUPERVISORS/DIRECTORS to have your back when one of the procedures that you haven’t been aware of changes!!! MINE DIDN’T!!

review_title: New Owner, hoping changes come quickly
job_title: Medical Laboratory Technologist in Sanford, NC
pros: The hospital has been bought out by Duke-Lifepoint and changes are happening for the best.. New instruments coming into the lab, new management and a much better work atmosphere. Easier to get days off, better schedules and people are becoming much happier. It will take time for all the new instruments to come on board but with these new instruments we can afford better patient care, looking forward to all the changes. The lab manager is new and it will take time for him to get up to speed on the clinical side and feel comfortable in his new role but he wants to lab to succeed and he seems to care about the employees.
cons: Heavy workload, old instruments in place right now, never know when you come into work which instrument will be off line, makes for a very stressful shift. Low pay compared to other hospitals, working with traveling techs (4). There are many changes going on with many new employees...the lab is finally getting up to the number of techs needed to run a lab in a hospital of this size, so while right now there are cons...these are all in the process of being fixed and the attention is on patient care. We are all in a wait and see mode, hoping Duke -Lifepoint takes this hospital seriously, if it does , it could be a great place to work. Right now, so many changes going on and not a lot of information being shared by management.

pros: It is a smaller campus compared to other local hospitals. Nice "community" feel to hospital.  DLP has a great mission statement and is doing great things for the community through the organization.  The Lifepoint organization is great organization.
cons: There is not thorough training when new processes are introduced and enforced.

pros: Steady check. It's nice to have a paying job. Plenty of chances for overtime. Ratios seem to be higher than they comfortably should be.
cons: Not enough help. Old equipment. They always have an opening or new hires from steady turn over. Too much confusion.

pros: The pay was good. Good co-workers.
cons: No benefits. Horrible, heartless  management.  Employees not appreciated and overworked. Understaffed- making it hard to get a lunch break, and hard to get off on time. Work load too heavy for just 2 techs to handle. Inconsistency in schedule- one day you're scheduled for 6 am, the next 4:30am, the next 5:00 am, the next 1pm; went from 8 hr work days to 10. High turnover rate. Dreadful place to work. No room for growth.

pros: Tuition reimbursement, full time benefits, 401 K
cons: Heavy patient load, consistently short staffed, under paid
